greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let S(1)=1, S(2)=10; S(2n)=concatenation of S(2n-1), S(2n-2) and 0; and S(2n+1)=concatenation of S(2n), S(2n) and 0. Sequence gives S(infinity).
comment: Number of terms in S(n) is A062318(n).
Interpreting S(n) in binary and converting to decimal gives 1,2,20,164,84296,43159880,5792821120672400,...,.
mathematica: a[1] = {1}; a[2] = {1, 0}; a[n_] := a[n] = If[EvenQ[n], Join[a[n - 1], a[n - 2], {0}] // Flatten, Join[a[n - 1], a[n - 1], {0}] // Flatten]; a[8] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 30 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 01 2006
